statements: SELECT * FROM employee_benefit_costs;
SELECT employee_id, cost, benefits_type FROM employee_benefit_costs;
SELECT benefits_type, cost FROM employee_benefit_costs WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM employee_benefit_costs ORDER BY cost DESC;
SELECT * FROM employee_benefit_costs WHERE benefits_type = 'Healthcare';
SELECT employee_id, benefits_type, cost FROM employee_benefit_costs WHERE cost > 100 ORDER BY cost DESC
SELECT employee_id, benefits_type, cost FROM employee_benefit_costs WHERE benefits_type='Health Insurance' ORDER BY employee_id
SELECT employee_id, benefits_type, AVG(cost) AS average_cost FROM employee_benefit_costs GROUP BY employee_id, benefits_type
SELECT DISTINCT benefits_type, COUNT(employee_id) AS employee_count FROM employee_benefit_costs GROUP BY benefits_type HAVING COUNT(employee_id) > 1
SELECT SUM(cost) AS total_cost FROM employee_benefit_costs
SELECT * FROM EmployeeBenefits;
SELECT employee_name, benefit_type, benefit_amount FROM EmployeeBenefits WHERE employee_id = 1001;
SELECT employee_id, employee_name FROM EmployeeBenefits WHERE benefit_type = 'Health Insurance';
SELECT * FROM FinancialPlanning WHERE planned_amount > 5000;
SELECT plan_name, planned_year FROM FinancialPlanning WHERE plan_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT * FROM EmployeeBenefits WHERE employee_id = 1
SELECT employee_name, benefit_type FROM EmployeeBenefits WHERE benefit_amount > 1000 ORDER BY benefit_type DESC
SELECT employee_name, benefit_amount FROM EmployeeBenefits WHERE benefit_type LIKE '%health%'
SELECT * FROM FinancialPlanning WHERE planned_year = 2022 ORDER BY planned_amount DESC
SELECT employee_name, benefit_type, benefit_amount FROM EmployeeBenefits WHERE employee_id IN (1, 3, 5)
SELECT * FROM employee WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT employee_name, salary FROM employee WHERE department = 'IT';
SELECT * FROM employee ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT employee_name, department, benefit_name FROM employee JOIN benefit ON employee.employee_id = benefit.employee_id;
SELECT department, COUNT(employee_id) as employee_count FROM employee GROUP BY department;
SELECT * FROM employee WHERE salary > 50000 ORDER BY employee_name DESC;
SELECT employee_name, department FROM employee WHERE department = 'IT' ORDER BY employee_name ASC;
SELECT e.employee_name, b.benefit_name, b.benefit_type FROM employee e JOIN benefit b ON e.employee_id = b.employee_id WHERE b.benefit_cost > 1000;
SELECT e.employee_name, COUNT(b.benefit_id) AS total_benefits FROM employee e JOIN benefit b ON e.employee_id = b.employee_id GROUP BY e.employee_name;
SELECT department, AVG(salary) AS avg_salary FROM employee GROUP BY department HAVING AVG(salary) > 60000 ORDER BY avg_salary DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, salary FROM employees WHERE department_id = 1;
SELECT department_name, location FROM departments;
SELECT * FROM benefits WHERE benefit_cost > 1000;
SELECT employee_name, hire_date FROM employees WHERE hire_date > '2021-01-01';
SELECT employee_name, hire_date, salary FROM employees;
SELECT * FROM benefits WHERE benefit_cost > 1000;
SELECT department_name, location FROM departments ORDER BY department_name ASC;
SELECT benefit_name, benefit_cost FROM benefits WHERE benefit_type = 'Health';
SELECT employee_name, hire_date, department_name FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.department_id = departments.department_id WHERE hire_date > '2021-01-01';
SELECT * FROM Employees;
SELECT first_name, last_name, salary FROM Employees ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT department, COUNT(*) AS total_employees FROM Employees GROUP BY department;
SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name, b.benefit_name FROM Employees e INNER JOIN Employee_Benefits eb ON e.employee_id = eb.employee_id INNER JOIN Benefits b ON eb.benefit_id = b.benefit_id;
SELECT d.department_name, SUM(b.total_budget) AS total_budget FROM Departments d INNER JOIN Budgets b ON d.department_id = b.department_id GROUP BY d.department_name;
SELECT * FROM Employees WHERE salary > 50000 ORDER BY last_name ASC
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM Employees WHERE department = 'HR' ORDER BY first_name DESC
SELECT department, AVG(salary) AS avg_salary FROM Employees GROUP BY department HAVING AVG(salary) > 60000
SELECT e.first_name, b.benefit_name FROM Employees e INNER JOIN Employee_Benefits eb ON e.employee_id = eb.employee_id INNER JOIN Benefits b ON eb.benefit_id = b.benefit_id WHERE b.cost < 1000

SELECT d.department_name, SUM(b.total_budget) AS department_budget FROM Departments d INNER JOIN Budgets b ON d.department_id = b.department_id GROUP BY d.department_name ORDER BY department_budget DESC
